explanation: [0-0] On a patch of ground sits a small, round, wooden table. On the table is a metal honeycomb mold. A person holds a metal ladle filled with liquid above the mold, which has solidified liquid around its edges.

[0-7] Next, he pours the liquid from the metal ladle into the mold. Once full, he puts down the ladle, grabs the metal handles on both sides of the mold, and closes it. Then, he presses down firmly on the mold, causing excess liquid to spill onto the table and the ground.

[0-7] Next, he pours the liquid from the metal ladle into the mold. Once full, he puts down the ladle, grabs the metal handles on both sides of the mold, and closes it. Then, he presses down firmly on the mold, causing excess liquid to spill onto the table and the ground.

[7-17] He then releases his hands and opens the mold. The liquid has solidified inside, taking on a yellow hue. Next, he tears off the excess edges around the mold with his hands, revealing the complete shape. Finally, he carefully begins to remove a corner from the upper right side with his right hand, then uses both hands to remove the entire piece.
